data.title: Royal Sonesta New Orleans â€“ Book Direct for Best Rates
data.meta_description: The Royal Sonesta New Orleans is a luxury Bourbon Street hotel in the French Quarter. Stay close to amazing attractions, shops, restaurants, and bars.
data.text:
Welcome to The Royal Sonesta New Orleans hotel, a stylish and sophisticated resort-like hotel located in the heart of the French Quarter on world-famous Bourbon Street â€” a hub of authentic jazz, vibrant nightlife, and authentic hospitality.

Our AAA Four-Diamond hotel in New Orleans features a range of upscale amenities to enhance your stay. Relax in our lush courtyard and pool, indulge in our lively on-site food and beverage outlets, or stay on top of your health routine at our 24-hour fitness center.

All the joys and indulgences of an ultimate New Orleans experience are here.

Take a Tour

We are committed to ensuring your stay is as comfortable as possible, and to accommodating the needs of all our guests,

including those with disabilities. If you have any special requests or requirements related to your disability, please don't hesitate to reach out. Your comfort and satisfaction are our top priorities.

The following areas are accessible:

Lobby entrance on Bourbon Street

Route from the hotelâ€™s lobby entrance to:

The registration area

The accessible guest rooms

Restaurants

The meeting room/ballroom area

The fitness center

The swimming pool

The business center

Concierge desk

Public restroom

Restaurant

Accessible parking spaces for vans and cars in self-parking facility

Fitness center

Swimming pool

Business center

The following areas are not fully accessible:

Registration desk

Additional accessibility information:

Hotel provides assistive listening devices for meetings upon request

Guest room TVs have closed captioning or closed caption decoders provided

Hotelâ€™s valet parking accepts vehicles specially outfitted for wheelchair users

Hotel has a TTY for guest use

Service animals are welcome

Braille and tactile signage is provided for permanent rooms and spaces

Hotel employees will read menus and other printed/visual information and provide verbal directions to locations in the hotel to guests who are blind/low vision

Audio/visual fire alarms in common areas

Information About Accessible Guest Suites

Our hotel has the following accessible suite types:

Mobility Accessible Deluxe King, Tub

Mobility Accessible King Patio, Tub

Mobility Accessible Two Doubles Patio, Tub

Mobility Accessible Interior Balcony King, Tub

Mobility Accessible Moderate Two Doubles, Roll-in Shower

Mobility Accessible RClub Concierge King, Tub

Mobility Accessible RClub Concierge Two Doubles, Roll-in Shower

Mobility Accessible Junior Suite King, Roll-in Shower

Mobility Accessible Junior Suite Two Queens, Tub

Hearing Accessible Interior Balcony King

Hearing Accessible Interior Balcony Two Doubles

Hearing Accessible Interior Balcony Two Queens

Hearing Accessible Deluxe King

Hearing Accessible Deluxe Two Queens

Hearing Accessible RClub Concierge Two Queens

Rooms designated as mobility accessible have features for guests with mobility disabilities, including, but not limited to:

Doorways that provide 32â€ of clear width

Roll-in shower or tub with grab bars (specific bathing fixture type is indicated for each room in the room name)

Lowered light switches and thermostats

Toilets with grab bars

Accessible vanity

Accessible route to all parts of the room

Rooms designated as hearing accessible have features for guests who are deaf or hard of hearing, including visual alarms and notification devices.

For general amenities associated with each suite type, please see our rooms page.

Please call us at 1.504.586.0300 should you have further questions about accessibility or email us at reservations@sonesta.com.

We thank you for your service. The Royal Sonesta New Orleans is proud to offer a discounted rate to Federal, State, Local Government, and U.S. Military employees when you book using code GOV.

Our AAA Four-Diamond rated New Orleans hotel offers a central location in the heart of the French Quarter, featuring classic wrought-iron balcony rooms overlooking vibrant Bourbon Street, Conti or Bienville Street.

Government Locations Near Us:

New Orleans City Hall (0.7 miles)

F. Edward Hebert Building (0.7 miles)

Hale Boggs Federal Building (0.8 miles)

Naval Air Station Joint Reserve Base (13 miles)

Please note that government rates are subject to availability, not available to groups, and require a valid Government or Military ID to be shown at check-in.

Book Our Government Rate

The site of The Royal Sonesta New Orleans dates back to 1721 when French military engineer Adrien de Pauger first laid out the city of New Orleans.

Originally, houses, courtyards, and carriageways occupied the 300 block of Bourbon Street. During the 19th Century, Bourbon Street became a thriving commercial district with everything from a costume shop to a winery. In 1890, the American Brewing Company purchased the winery and expanded the building to encompass an entire city block.

Nearly 70 years later, the owners of the Sonesta brand at that time, the Sonnabends, were introduced to developer Lester Kabacoff and soon the site of the old brewery would be repurposed. In 1967, the Vieux Carre Commission approved plans to begin construction of what would become a landmark French Quarter hotel.

Two years later, The Royal Sonesta New Orleans opened its doors.

Art Collection

Initiated in the early 1960s, Sonesta's Art Collection is one of the first corporate hotel programs dedicated to original art by nationally and internationally known artists.

This group of works consists of more than 7,000 contemporary paintings, sculptures, original prints, and tapestries by both emerging and established artists such as Frank Stella, Andy Warhol, Roy Lichtenstein, Sol Lewitt, Jan Dibbets, Malcolm Morley, and Carl Palazzolo.

The works reflect the artist's vision while illuminating some of the most significant movements in contemporary art, including Conceptual, Minimal and Pop Art.

The works of art at The Royal Sonesta New Orleans are in our public spaces like the lobby and PJ's Coffee Cafe. Each work of art was carefully considered to create an aesthetically pleasing and meaningful statement.

Many works have been specially commissioned for a particular space, in an effort to fully integrate the architecture and design of the hotel.

At The Royal Sonesta New Orleans, we are proud to offer a wide array of amenities and features, all designed to make your stay as relaxing and memorable as possible.

Pool and Oasis Pool Bar

Soak up the sun and buzzing Bourbon Street energy at our outdoor heated swimming pool and Oasis Pool Bar (both open seasonally) at The Royal Sonesta New Orleans. One of the largest pools in the French Quarter, our New Orleans hotel swimming pool is chlorine-chemical-free and heated.

Pool Hours

Monday - Thursday: 12:00 PM - 7:00 PM

Friday - Sunday: 11:00 AM - 7:00 PM

Pool hours are subject to change based on weather. Please note the pool does not have a lifeguard on duty. Children aged 16 and under need to be accompanied by an adult.

Sonesta Sundays, Presented by Baccardi

Join us throughout the summer for Sonesta Sundays, presented by Baccardi. Take a dip, soak up the sunshine in the beautiful surrounding courtyard, and vibe to the freshest beats of the city.

Every Sunday starting May 12, 2024 - September 29, 2024

Hours: 2:00 PM - 6:00 PM

Live Entertainment every Sunday presented by Red Bull

Full bar with daiquiri machines

Grilled food available for purchase

Pool chic attire, swimsuits

Purchase Sonesta Sundays Tickets

Concierge Service

Whether youâ€™re looking to arrange a special surprise or book an appointment at the best hair salon in town, our concierge is at your disposal to accommodate even the most daring request.

Wi-Fi

Stay connected with complimentary high-speed wireless Internet, accessible in guest rooms, public spaces, and meeting spaces.

Fitness Center

Stay on top of your workout and health routine even while traveling at our state-of-the-art fitness center, available 24 hours a day to our hotel guests. With the latest cardio, strength training equipment, and pool, you'll feel relaxed and energized.

Business Center

Guests with a room key have access to our business center â€“ located next to the Front Desk â€“ 24 hours a day. Our Business Center is self-serviced by credit card and includes services such as free Wi-Fi connectivity, computer stations, printing, faxing, and photocopies. Learn more about Computer & Equipment Rental Services by The Royal Productions at www.royalproductions.com.

Driving Directions to The Royal Sonesta New Orleans

The French Quarter is mostly one-way narrow streets. Vehicular traffic on Bourbon Street is stopped nightly at dusk allowing pedestrians more space to explore. Some trucks, buses, and mini coaches are encouraged to check ahead for alternate driving directions to accommodate your larger vehicle in the French Quarter. When Bourbon Street is closed, you can access the hotel's underground Parking Garage situated between Conti Street and Bienville Street. The lower lobby, which provides access to the main lobby, is located on this level. The French Quarter is mostly one-way narrow streets. Vehicular traffic on Bourbon Street is stopped nightly at dusk allowing pedestrians more space to explore.

*Please note that directions may change due to special events, and traffic flow pattern changes.

Taxi and Rideshare (Uber & Lyft)

Taxis are readily available at the Louis Armstrong New Orleans International Airport. If using a ride-share service, please request through the official app on your smartphone. Upon arrival at The Royal Sonesta New Orleans, please instruct the driver to drop you off at 300 Bourbon Street so you may enter through our lobby. If there happens to be traffic restrictions, or youâ€™re dropped off during Bourbon Streetâ€™s pedestrian mall hours, you may enter through our lower level lobby through our Parking Garage. Taxi cabs and ride-shares are permitted to use the 300 block of Bourbon Street from 6 am to 4 pm daily.

Streetcar

RTAâ€™s streetcars offer you a unique way around New Orleans. There are the Red Line streetcars, conveniently located on Canal Street just two blocks away from the hotel's entrance. You can access the Green Line streetcar at Carondelet Street and Canal Street.

The standard fare for a one-way trip on a streetcar is$1.25 per person, with children 2 years old and under riding free. For unlimited rides, consider purchasing a daily Jazzy Pass for just $3.00, or $8.00 for three days.

Visit the RTA website for more information.

Private Transportation & Limousines

Please call our Concierge at 504.553.2229 to assist with transportation options that include a town car, SUV, limousine, and more.

Located on the lobby level just off the main entrance, The Royal Sonesta New Orleans proudly presents The Jazz Playhouse, one of the finest local jazz clubs hosting the city's top jazz virtuosos.

Enjoy originally crafted cocktails and appetizers inspired by New Orleans jazz culture in a luxurious Art Deco atmosphere.

The club hosts some of the cityâ€™s greatest contemporary jazz and burlesque talents as resident acts including Big Sam, Nayo Jones, The Brass-a-Holics, and Trixie Minx, but also brings in special guests to spice up the lineup!

Explore The Jazz Playhouse website for more information.

Admission

Admission to The Jazz Playhouse is reserved for ticket holders only due to limited seating.

Guests must be at least 21 years old to attend.

Check out our upcoming shows and purchase tickets.

Groups / Private Events

Host your group function at The Jazz Playhouse. For groups or private event requests of 8 â€“ 49 people, please email jazzplayhouse@sonesta.com or call 504.553.2299 with your preferred date, number of attendees, and any special requests!

For buyouts or private events of 50+ people, please email rsnosales@sonesta.com or call 504.553.2205 and a Catering Sales Manager will assist in planning your event.

Hours of Operation

Closed: Monday & Tuesday

Wednesday: 4:00PM â€“ 10:30PM

Thursday: 4:00PM â€“ 10:30PM

Friday: 4:00PM â€“ 10:30PM

Saturday: 4:00PM â€“ 10:30PM

Sunday: 4:00PM â€“ 10:30PM

Please note that this is a smoke-free property.

Located on the lobby level of our Bourbon Street Hotel, just across the courtyard, R'evolution is a renowned restaurant and bar.

Restaurant Râ€™evolution

Take one city steeped in tradition and fortified with a tenacious spirit. Combine it with a cross-cultural fusion of food and flavors built on the culinary history of seven nations that contributed to its unique flavor, and what do you get? Restaurant Râ€™evolution, offering modern, imaginative reinterpretations of classic Cajun and Creole cuisine. Nestled in the heart of the French Quarter and known for its award-winning cuisine, Restaurant Râ€™evolution is a favorite among locals and visitors alike.

Bar Râ€™evolution

From chef-driven seasonal cocktails to extensive wine offerings sourced from around the world, you'll find a beverage to suit every taste at Bar Râ€™evolution. To complement the drink menu, discover tantalizing highlights from our restaurant. All of this awaits you in a charming gas lantern-lit setting reminiscent of a mid-1800s French Quarter carriageway.

Hours of Operation

Dinner

Sunday - Thursday: 5:00 PM â€“ 9:00 PM

Friday & Saturday: 5:00 PM â€“ 10:00 PM

Bar Happy Hour

Daily: 4:00 PM â€“ 6:00 PM

Reservations

Reserve online or contact the restaurant at 504.553.2277.

Purchase a Gift Card

Visit the Restaurantâ€™s Website

Attire

Please avoid wearing t-shirts, flip-flops, activewear, swimwear, or ballcaps in our main dining room.

If you prefer a more relaxed vibe, check out our smart casual dining options at Bar R'evolution.

Parking & Valet

The Royal Sonesta garage is accessible from Bienville and Conti Streets.

Discounted valet parking is available at the Bienville Street entrance or in The Royal Sonesta New Orleans garage.

Situated along world-famous Bourbon Street, on the lobby level of our hotel, Desire Oyster Bar offers diners one of the most authentic culinary experiences in New Orleans.

An iconic, Broadway-style marquis sign lights up the entrance, welcoming visitors and locals to grab a seat at the bar or table and enjoy one of the signature delicacies of the Big Easy.

Pull up a seat at the raw bar where expert shuckers prepare fresh Gulf oysters chargrilled, on the half shell and more.

Desire's interior design tastefully blends the propertyâ€™s original, iconic aesthetics with modern design elements inspired by the architectural styles prevalent throughout the Vieux Carre.

Decorative iron grillwork paired with oversized windows and an antique mirror reveal the fully stocked bar and serve as the backdrop for the Desire bar. Signature features like the tin ceiling and black-and-white checkered floors give depth to a contemporary bar, highboy tables, and state of the art chargrill station.

The color palette and design elements have been carefully curated to complement the existing materials while creating a fresh look for our restaurant on Bourbon Street.

Menu Highlights

Fresh Gulf seafood

Award-winning Gumbo

Variety of Po'boys

Shrimp Omelet Etouffee

Biscuits and Gravy

Oysters: fried, chargrilled, or on the half shell

Fried Chicken & Waffles

Louisiana Crab Cakes

Blackened Catfish Lafitte

Shrimp Remoulade

Explore Desire Oyster Bar

Contact the Restaurant at 504.553.2281

Explore The Menu

Lunch & Dinner Menu

Located on the lobby level of our hotel with a front-row view of Bourbon Street, Le Booze stands as a premier whiskey destination and a local favorite. With 60" TVs, perfect for watching sporting events, this bar offers an extensive selection of whiskey, both bottled and on tap, as well as an array of cocktails, complemented by tantalizing appetizers and indulgent bites.

Happy Hour

Kick back after work with colleagues or friends or enjoy an early start to your night out at Le Booze. Treat yourself to your favorite drinks and half-priced appetizers during our happy hour from 4:00 PM to 6:00 PM.

View Menu

Experience the VIP box seat on Bourbon Street with our Bourbon Balcony Hospitality Suite, a favorite for groups and hospitality functions, located on the second and third floors of the hotel.

With French doors that open onto spacious, covered wrought-iron balconies, the Suites face Bourbon, Conti, and Bienville Streets.

Ranging from one to four bedrooms attached to a parlor, these coveted suites have built-in bars and space for a reception accommodating from 10 to 175 people â€“ with a birdâ€™s eye view of one of the most storied streets in the world!

Our dedicated Catering Sales team and Executive Chef bring expertise and innovation to our hospitality suites. Please contact us to make your arrangements for this one-of-a-kind experience!

Hospitality Suite Guidelines

Bourbon Balcony Hospitality Suite Fact Sheet

Request for Event Proposal

For more information, please contact our Sales Office at 504.553.2205 or rsnosales@sonesta.com

The Royal Sonesta New Orleans offers so much more than classic elegance.

From our authentic French Quarter courtyard, iconic wrought-iron balconies, and outstanding culinary experiences to private rooms for bridal showers, brunches, and teas, our hotel stands out as a perfect New Orleans wedding venue.

Our experienced staff will guarantee a memorable event and will coordinate as many of the arrangements as you would like.

We can assist you with everything including engagement parties, rehearsal dinners, entertainment, transportation, photography, videography, and flowers. We can also arrange for massages, manicures, pedicures, and hair services before your ceremony.

Explore Venue

Download Our Brochure

Contact Us

Ready to plan your big day or wedding celebration? Contact the Sales and Catering Department to take a tour or for more information at 504.553.2205 or rsnosales@sonesta.com.

Mardi Gras, also known as "Fat Tuesday," is a world-renowned celebration deeply rooted in history, primarily associated with New Orleans, Louisiana. The origins of Mardi Gras trace back thousands of years to ancient Roman festivals. Over the centuries, the celebration evolved, integrating elements from various cultures, including African, Spanish, and Native American influences.

By the 19th century, Mardi Gras had become a well-established tradition in New Orleans. The first recorded Mardi Gras parade took place in 1837, marking the beginning of the city's iconic parade tradition. New Orleans' vibrant celebration includes elaborate floats, masked balls, and the throwing of beads and trinkets, becoming central features of the festivities.

Today, Mardi Gras remains a vital part of New Orleans' culture, drawing millions of visitors annually. The festival is known for its vibrant and inclusive atmosphere, showcasing the rich cultural tapestry of the city and its people.

Experience Mardi Gras in New Orleans

Mardi Gras is more than just a festival; it's a profound cultural experience that captures the essence of New Orleans. From the historical origins to the modern-day celebrations, Mardi Gras continues to be a symbol of unity, diversity, and the joyous spirit of the Crescent City.

The Royal Sonesta New Orleans Presents: The Greasing of the Poles

Known as the French Quarterâ€™s official kickoff to Mardi Gras weekend, this exclusive New Orleans event is not to be missed. The Greasing of the Poles is one of the most unique and entertaining events of the Mardi Gras season. This event always occurs on the Friday before Mardi Gras, only at The Royal Sonesta New Orleans.

History of The Greasing of the Poles

The Royal Sonesta New Orleans began this quirky tradition in 1968, originally as a practical measure to prevent enthusiastic revelers from climbing the buildingâ€™s support poles to access the balcony. Over the past 50+ years, the event has evolved into a celebrity-studded, music-filled celebration that draws hundreds of people to the French Quarter.

What to Expect

The Greasing of the Poles features local celebrities and performers who entertain the crowd with music, dance, and colorful costumes. This lively event embodies the spirit of fun and creativity that defines New Orleans and Mardi Gras.

Learn More About Our Mardi Gras Tradition

For more information on this Mardi Gras tradition, visit Kick Off Mardi Gras Weekend with The Greasing of the Poles

Experience Mardi Gras From Our Bourbon Street Balconies

Experience Mardi Gras in the heart of the French Quarter from The Royal Sonesta New Orleans exclusive Bourbon Street Balconies. Carnival season in New Orleans brings a diverse array of revelers to Bourbon Street. While no parades pass through the French Quarter, there is still plenty of Carnival action to soak in from our prime location.

Reserve Your Bourbon Street Balcony Experience

It's never too early to reserve your Mardi Gras Bourbon Balcony Experience. Our dedicated Catering Sales team and Executive Chef combine expertise, innovation, and New Orleans tradition to offer an unforgettable experience in our Bourbon Balcony Rooms and Suites.

Limited inventory is available. Please contact us to make your arrangements for this one-of-a-kind event. Reach out by phone or email to our Catering & Sales Department at salesroyalsonestaneworleans@sonesta.com or 504-553-2205.

Elevate Your Mardi Gras Experience

Our Bourbon Balcony Hospitality Suites will elevate your Mardi Gras experience, providing a bird's-eye view of all the action on Bourbon Street. These suites offer:

Full-service in-house catering and specialized room service

In-house AV company

Capacity for up to 175 guests

15 suites facing Bourbon Street, including 12 Balcony Suites

3 Hospitality Suites with wrought-iron balconies, parlors with wet bars: The Bienville Corner Suite, Center Bourbon Suite, and Conti Corner Suite.

For more details and to make a reservation, reach out by phone or email to our Catering & Sales Department at salesroyalsonestaneworleans@sonesta.com or 504-553-2205.

1. Do you offer parking near Bourbon Street?

Yes, we offer a 24-hour valet parking service at our parking garage, located at 700 Conti Street/700 Bienville Street.

2. Is The Royal Sonesta New Orleans hotel a good choice for families?

Absolutely! With our seasonal outdoor pool and generously sized, beautifully decorated rooms, our Bourbon street hotel is a great choice for families.

3. Is your hotel among the pet-friendly hotels in New Orleans?

Yes, The Royal Sonesta New Orleans hotel is pet friendly, and we will be happy to welcome your pet for a "pawsome" stay!

4. Is your French Quarter, New Orleans hotel good for business travelers?

Most definitely. Our strategic location in the heart of New Orleansâ€™ iconic French Quarter places you in the center of the action, a stoneâ€™s throw away from the key designations in New Orleans. Meanwhile, our generous services and amenities will elevate your business trip from an assignment to a unique experience.

5. Where is The Royal Sonesta New Orleans Hotel located in the French Quarter?

Our luxury hotel in the French Quarter, New Orleans is located at 300 Bourbon Street, minutes away from the most iconic sights in New Orleans!
